actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend title 18 of the United States Code to provide in certain circumstances the death penalty for kidnaping, and to establish a rebuttable presumption with respect to certain unexplained disappearances.

summary.text: Establishes the death penalty for kidnapping if the person has not been liberated unharmed. States that failure of a person, who voluntarily travels with another, to arrive after a ressonable time creates a rebuttable presumption that the person has been decoyed or inveigled.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 18 of the United States Code to provide in certain circumstances the death penalty for kidnaping, and to establish a rebuttable presumption with respect to certain unexplained disappearances.
